name: WinSCP
description: SFTP, SCP and FTP client using the WinSCP libary on Windows used from Powershell
author: Arjan van Rijn
helpMarkDown: SFTP, SCP and FTP client. Uses [winscp](https://winscp.net) and is in essence a wrapper around the [Session.Putfiles](https://winscp.net/eng/docs/library_session_putfiles) method. Putfiles overwrites existing remote files by default. Protocol and port should be specified in the Ftp connection address.

inputs.name: FtpEndpoint
inputs.label: FTP Connection
inputs.helpMarkDown: The Ftp connection to use. Should contain the Ftp protocol and port number

inputs.name: SshEndpoint
inputs.label: SSH endpoint
inputs.helpMarkDown: SSH endpoint with connection details for the remote machine.

inputs.name: RemotePath
inputs.label: Remote Path
inputs.helpMarkDown: The remote folder path on the server

inputs.name: FtpSecure
inputs.label: Encryption
inputs.helpMarkDown: TLS/SSL Implicit encryption, TLS/SSL explicit encryption or No encyption. Based on the WinSCP.FtpSecure enumeration.

inputs.name: FtpMode
inputs.label: Connection mode
inputs.helpMarkDown: Passive or Active ftp connection mode. Based on the WinSCP.FtpMode enumeration.

inputs.name: TestInputFilePath
inputs.label: Test the Input FilePath
inputs.helpMarkDown: Test if the input file path exists and fail the task if not. Disabling this allows for using the WinSCP Session.Putfiles Wilcard support ( * and ? )
